body.content: the girls are free to choose to wear either a ribbon or a necktie,
it's an unspoken rule that they aren't allowed to wear neckties.
For my assignment, Hinami told me who to talk to and what to talk about.
The first one sits next to you: Yuzu Izumi.

The second one will be next to you
in home ec: Minami Nanami.
The third one, you find for yourself.
As for what you'll talk about...
I caught a cold, but forgot to bring some.

To talk to someone
you've never talked to before,
you need a simple topic to start with.

You'll be wearing a mask.
Say you have cold.
Oh, sorry, I don't have any.
Hey, Kikuchi–san, do you have any tissues?
Erika! That eyeshadow you said they killed!
Does this count as talking to her?
N–No, um, my teeth hurt too!
This makes them kind of better!

"Lv. 2 – It Feels Great When You Level Up
Multiple Times from One Battle"
When you talk to them, make sure I'm nearby.
She's on the track team with Hinami.
She's another major player in the class.
That means I don't need to do anything yet.
I'm not cowering in fear, I'm just following Hinami's instructions.
What's up, Tomozaki–kun? You're here early!
She talked to me! I can't ignore her!
–Hello? –If I told her the real reason I'm early...
She'll think I'm way too creepy and kill me!
–What's wrong? Hello? –What do I do? What do I say?
The conversation's already started. I need to keep it going.
It wasn't very specific or anything,

I just thought young girls
these days have a lot of empathy.
Are you a grandpa or something?

No, I was just saying,
young girls these days–

you know how high school girls these days
use the word "bad" to describe everything?

I meant it in that sense, how girls
have the empathy to understand–

Stop! Stop talking like
one of those experts on TV!
I don't need that! Answer the question!

Well, Tomozaki–kun's acting
like an old guy, and...
Oh? Hey, Nakamu! Tomozaki–kun's really funny!
Nanami–san said I was here early,
and I answered that I just came,

So I was just saying that girls these
days have a lot of empathy,
Oh? You just have no sense of humor.
No, yours is just weird, Mimimi.
Then do we take a vote?
–Natsubayashi–san's acting strange. –Me! Me! Me! Me! Me!
but it'll be awkward if Natsubayashi–san is the only one who doesn't raise hers.
I'll put a vote on this side too.
Hold up, Aoi, you're not in this.
What? I was listening, so why not?
You lost to Tomozaki–kun in Attack Fams.

Don't take it out on him here.
It's not very manly!
Okay, so Mimimi and me make two votes.
Oh! A vote from Tama too!
So Shuji has no sense of humor.
Darn. Well, a vote's a vote.

Then let's get an Attack Fams
rematch against Tomozaki–kun.
I nearly ruined the mood again.
It always shows on your face.
Nice try, Tama! You did good!
–Oh? You like it here? –Wh–What's going on?
Oh? Aoi, you sure you want me to?
You're really sensitive here, aren't you?
That's it! No more sexual harassment.

What do you mean? You can be
a tough mama to understand sometimes.

It wasn't a good one.
Just accept my gratitude.
You saved me earlier too. Thank you.

You're funnier than I thought
you were, Tomozaki–kun.
I was laughing behind you the whole time.

He was like one of those
experts on TV, right?

Only the teachers call you
Nanami–san these days.

Oh, you know? "Hanabi" means
"fireworks," so you go "Tamaya!"

"Second Sewing Room"
Why I made fun of Nakamura?
I'd need to do that eventually anyway.

Nakamura has a grudge against you
for beating him at Attack Fams.
It's so heavy that people won't bring it up.
He's a major player in the class,

so if he's angry at you,
your position won't be stable.
That's bad if you want to be a normie.

So we needed to make his emotions
explode as soon as possible.

Yes. Say it in front of everyone
and turn it into a joke.
You say it like it's easy, but it's not.
Well, no one else could've done it.
Just that I'm really bad at talking.

Like, I can't say anything
smart or thoughtful.
But you were pretty good in the home ec room.

For a first attempt, your mission
today was a complete success.

But you were a complete
failure the rest of the day.

You showed Kikuchi–san that you
were smiling under your mask,

and you didn't turn away when
you were blowing your nose.

You failed so hard,
how unepic it was was epic!
Hinami–san, the difference between your compliments and insults is intense.

Anything else you're curious
about apart from that?
She was acting a bit weird.

Oh, she's a stubborn
girl–or should I say honest?
She doesn't follow the mood or the situation.
Mimimi and me love her for it,

but she's a bad match with someone like
Nakamura who uses the mood to communicate,
so they've fought a few times over it.

but he does want to make her
play the game at least once.
Oh, that sounds like a pain.

I wish Mimimi and I could stay
with her all the time,
but we can't, so it's a problem.
All right. I think that's enough for today.

We'll be working on your
posture tomorrow, so be ready.

"Today's Assignment: Posture"
The mind and body are connected.

When your posture is good,
you'll feel less timid.

I'm just touching your butt.
Don't make a ruckus.
This is kind of tough to keep.

Because you're using muscles
you don't usually use.

From now on, whenever
you stand, it'll be like this.
You can take off the mask.

"Today's Assignment: Posture"
And in addition to today's assignment,

you'll be joining me and
talking to Mimimi and Hanabi
and any boys that I'm friends with.

"Join conversations (this week)"
You'll be doing that all week.
You're saying it like it's easy again.
Get a girlfriend before my third year, right?
It's building the groundwork for that.

Watch the girls reactions when you talk to
them and pay attention to the mood.
I want to set your direction based on that.

Who you'll be friends with and
what you need to practice.
Of course. When you fight a boss in a game,

you need to know if their skills
and your level match up, right?

Yeah. Whenever you make
a game metaphor, I have to agree.

Today, we're going home with Hashiguchi–kun,
Matsumoto–kun, and Mimimi.
Remember to participate in the conversation.
You're doing it outside club too?

Th–Then are you building
your butt muscles too?
Oh! I work out my butt too!
You work it out at home?
So the secret to Aoi's nice body
But here's something you should know.

You and Mimimi both get off
at Kita–Yono Station.
Don't run away. Do it right, okay?
Oh, so you get off at Kita–Yono too?
Hey, no need to be nervous!

I'm gonna live on cheer
and smiles alone! That's me!
That's amazing. It sounds pretty hard.

I mean, there are times when
you can't smile or be cheerful.

When times are hard, you need to smile.
If you don't, it'll just get harder.

Oh, Hinami did say the mind
and body were connected.
Oh? Sounds like you're friendly with her.
I've been a bit curious to know.

So, Mr. Tomozaki, are you in
an interesting relationship with Aoi?

You've been making a lot of
suspicious eye contact lately.

Why would Aoi Hinami want
anything to do with me?
That convinced you way too quick.

You're good. You really are
funny sometimes, Tomozaki!

Why aren't you fun like this all the time?
You're always looking so gloomy.
I'm okay with not having fun all the time.
Fun isn't always the right answer.
For example, I like Attack Fams.
Oh, I heard you were super good.

It's like, I'm not playing
Attack Fams to have fun.

I like Attack Fams,
so I work really hard at it.

It's like, the fun part comes
with the hard work.
I think you're a lot like Tama, Tomozaki.

She's straight as an arrow, or like,
she doesn't bend to the breeze.

Like, if you're in a situation where bending
to the mood would make it more fun,
she won't do it unless it's her thing.
Meanwhile, I only know how to bend.

I bend and bend, like, I'm gonna make
everything fun no matter what!
So, what do you think? Cute?
I'm actually a very troubled young maiden.

Though my troubles are
nothing compared to Tama's.
That's true. It must be pretty hard for her.

That's why I have to protect her,
since I bend all the time!
I see. So you support each other.
That's it! We support each other!

Except I guess you could say
it's more like I support Tama.
Looks like you did pretty well.

Well, Mimimi set the conversation
on topics I could talk about.

but it seems you're good
at saying exactly what you think.
Isn't that something everyone's good at?
She bends to the mood, right?

Do you think she's good
at saying what she thinks?

Mimimi's good at saying things
that match people around her.

–No!
–She's good at saying what she thinks, right?

After talking to lots of different people,
did you find anyone else similar to her?
Now that you mention it, no.
Saying exactly what you think is hard?
So in a sense, that's your weapon.

If you end up in any sort of trouble,
you should use it.

Anything else you've noticed with
more conversation experience?

I noticed something like
different roles in a conversation.
Hey, listen to this! In club yesterday...

Mimimi always starts with
"Hey, listen to this!"
She's in charge of bringing up a new topic.
Oh, something like that happened to me too!
Someone else expands on the topic.
In this group, you usually play that role.

Everyone in the group
expands the conversation,

but the ones bringing up the topic
are always you or Mimimi.

Which means that getting
better at conversation means

getting better at bringing up topics
or expanding on topics.

Now you just need to think
about how to get better at those.
I've heard that "Hexactly!" thing twice now.

Well, all right.
That's twice now, so I'll tell you.

When I was little, it was a line in my
favorite retro game, "Go Shootemup Oinkem."

It looks like a game
made to sell a character,

but the story is really well written,
on the theme of when it's right to fight.

And at the same time, the world stimulates
a kid's imagination with cute characters!
I remember that. You liked that too?

You know Oinkem?! You really are
the best gamer in Japan!
No one knows the game at all!
Back to the topic at hand.

you need to bring up new topics
and expand on topics.
You just need to practice these.

"Where you laughed in
episode 3 of 'The Secret Father'"
You'll never run out of topics with this.

I recorded our entire
conversation here today.

Listen to it later and check
on how you communicated.
Now, then. Let's talk about Saturday.
That's the point. I don't have club.
We'll meet at Omiya Station at 11 AM.
You're going to be out with me the whole day.
